chapter.title: Quality of Service area
chapter.para: The Optical Quality of Service (QoS) indicator is a judgement of the quality of the user's service based on data computed by the NA-F Dynamic Line Management system. NA-F determines the service impact from various tests it can perform, and the @@ProductName@@ system determines the impact to the user and displays a visual indication.
In the Customer Service Console, the QoS area shows, for the subscriber's optical line, the Status of the line and a Quality of Service indicator. QoS area
The relevant item from Confluence for this is https://confluence.motive.com/display/soldev/FTTXST-3+FTTx+Service+Snapshot+with+QoS+Indicator

Status icon
The Status icon shows the current line status.(This information is available from the NA-F NBI methods GetOpticalLinkParameters and GetOpticalLinkHistoricalServiceImpact.) Optical line status icons and their meanings
Icon Meaning
The line is working properly (line is up).
The line is not working (line is down).
The line is up now, but has been down in the last line-checking interval (line was recently down).
The system checks the line status at an interval defined by the NAFCSR.QoS.Indicator.History.Hours
@@sibling@@ environment property environment property, which defaults to 24. For more information, see Customizing environment properties.
QoS indicator
The QoS indicator provides one of the following values for the current quality of service:(This information is available from the NA-F NBI methods GetOpticalLinkHistoricalServiceImpact.)
GOOD: service-impacting fiber issues are not detected.
BAD: service-impacting fiber issues are detected.
MARGINAL: fiber issues may exist that are impairing service.
UNKNOWN: for exception cases when the Optical QoS cannot be determined.
Faults icon
Place your mouse cursor over the Faults icon (
) to see whether any faults have been detected; the system displays one of the following messages in a box below the icon:
No faults detected.
Click to see detected faults: When this text appears, you can click on the icon to display the table of Detected Issues and Recommendations.
